intro: Rhaphiolepis balgooyi, commonly known as the Cape rose. It is a flowering shrub native to southern Africa, characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and produces clusters of small, pink or white blossoms. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for coastal gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
